instruction: This code defines a Python class called PcaPlotVector that inherits from BaseCClass and has several methods for accessing and manipulating data. To use this code, import the necessary modules from ert.cwrap, ert.enkf, and ert.util. Then, create an instance of the PcaPlotVector class with the required arguments: an integer component, a Matrix object for the principal component matrix, and a Matrix object for the observation principal component matrix. The resulting object can be used to access the data stored in the matrices, including the size, individual values, observation value, and singular value. When finished using the object, call the free() method to release the memory allocated for it.
